page.title: 19Medical Services
page.content: Two medical practices serve Stillingfleet and Kelfield: one from Ricall , the other from Escrick. Prescriptions are dispensed at the surgery or by a chemist in Selby or York. In an emergency a drug can be collected from the cottage hospital in Selby. There is a rota system of volunteers in Stillingfleet to take people to surgery or hospital appointments. District nurses and health visitors visit as necessary. A mobile chiropody unit visits Stillingfleet once every three months. This is funded by the N.H.S. and run by the Women Royal Voluntary Service. Acaster Selby residents can call on the services of Doctors and other medical auxilliaries in Tadcaster and Copmanthorpe(York).
